Package main.model

Class CircularParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.model.CircularParser
  • public class CircularParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Note: This is the first version of the CircularParser. It does not yet account for sequencing errors (e.g. overlaps in the reference sequence or a read missing bases in homopolymers such as polyA regions). I am currently working on finding a solution to these problems, but firstly, a statistical analysis will be implemented to help finding a good algorithmic solution.

    Parses a BAM file constructing circular reads if present. A read is called circular if it is aligned at least two times to the reference sequence such that it overlaps both at the beginning and at the end of the reference sequences in a fitting manner such that these occurrences of the same read can be combined to one occurrence.

    Author:
    Mauro Di Girolamo

    • Field Detail

      • readMap

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<Read>> readMap
        A HashMap structured such that duplicate reads can be found easily. This is achieved by using the read names as the index of the HashMap and a list of Read object as the values so that each list contains duplicates of the same read being mapped to different positions of the reference sequence. parseBAMFile( ) uses this attribute to save its output.

    • Constructor Detail

      • getReadMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<Read>> getReadMap()
        Returns CircularParser.readMap.
        Returns:
        CircularParser.readMap

      • parseBAMFile

        public static void parseBAMFile​(java.io.File bamFile)
        Iterates over all mapped reads in a BAM file representing them as Read objects while detecting circular reads and saving these into a convenient representation. The output is saved into the readMap attribute.
        Parameters:
        bamFile - the BAM file to be parsed

      • constructCircularRead

        private static void constructCircularRead​(Read oldRead,
                                          htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord newReadRecord,
                                          boolean oldReadIsLeft)
        Constructs a circular read given two presentations of the same read aligned fittingly such that one overlaps at the beginning and the other one at the end. Updates alignmentStart / getAlignmentEnd, builds a new fitting Cigar combing the two old ones and transfers the sequence from the newReadRecord if the oldRead is hard clipped. After applying the algorithm, ( Read is combined <=> read.alignmentStart > read.alignmentEnd ) holds.
        Parameters:
        oldRead - the read which was already seen by the CircularParser
        newReadRecord - the new read found in the BAM record
        oldReadIsLeft - whether the oldRead is left (that is to say, mapped to the beginning of the reference sequence)

      • createNewReadFromSAMRecord

        private static Read createNewReadFromSAMRecord​(htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord record)
        Creates a new Read object given a SAMRecord representation of the Read.
        Parameters:
        record -
        Returns:
        the Read representation of the read
